intro: Turnera dichotoma var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Passifloraceae family, which includes passionflowers, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and elliptical, while its flowers are usually yellow with a distinctive corona, attracting various pollinators.
